page.title: 06Farming: Mell farm
page.content: Mell Farm has 400+ Arable and 600+ marshland, altogether it has 1000+ acres. It keeps sheep and cattle on the marshland and orphaned lambs in the back garden. They grow wheat, barley, rape, hay and straw. The land is gravel on highland clay half way and marsh near the River Blackwater. The farm has got two Renults, two Fords, one crawler tractor and two trailers. It also has combines, seed-drills, ploughs, discs, a dryer and a cultivator. living on Mell Farm is hard work but exciting and you learn each day. Half the house is original Tudar. We also breed pheasant chicks in the spring which we then set free. My dad is going to dig out a pond soon for wild-life.
